body:
Comment 3: 
I don't think this is worth the effort.
6l needs to be able to do random access on its input,
so at best it would be spooling standard input to a
temporary file anyway.  The same goes for its output.
This is uncommon enough that I don't think it is
worth extra effort in 6l.

If you really want to, it works right now to do
    6g -o /dev/stdout /dev/stdin.

but you have to be aware that 6g also prints
compile errors to standard output, so you'd
have to check the exit code and even then
hope that you didn't get some errors and some
binary at the same time.  

Please use files.  That's what they're for.
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
